text: The District is a film and television company started in 2014 by film director Ruben Fleischer and former RipCord Productions employee David Bernard. == History == The District was started on June 24, 2014 by film director Ruben Fleischer and RipCord Productions employee David Bernard, and it will kick off with a two-year overall deal at Universal Television, allowing it to produce comedies and dramas. The studio's first production, Superstore, was picked up to series by NBC on May 7, 2015. It eventually become a hit series. Its next project was The Bold Type, which was picked up by Freeform on January 10, 2017. == Productions == === Film === {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year !Title !Director !Distributor !Notes |- |2017 |Unicorn Store |Brie Larson |Netflix |co-production with Rip Cord Productions, Rhea Films, Sycamore Pictures, Hercules Film Fund and 51 Entertainment |- |2020 |Bad Trip |Kitao Sakurai |Netflix |co-production with Bron Creative, Orion Pictures, Gorilla Flicks and Helo |} === Television === {| class="wikitable sortable" !Years !Title !Creator !Network !Notes |- |2015–present |Superstore |Justin Spitzer |NBC |co-production with Miller Green Broadcasting (season 5), Spitzer Holding Company, and Universal Television |- |2017–present |The Bold Type |Sarah Watson |Freeform |co-production with Sarah Watson Productions and Universal Television |- |2019–2020 |Stumptown |Jason Richman based on Stumptown by: Greg Rucka, Matthew Southworth, Justin Greenwood |ABC |co-production with Don't Tell Mom and ABC Studios |} == References == == External links == * The District at IMDb Category:Entertainment companies of the United States Category:Film production companies of the United States Category:Television production companies of the United States Category:Entertainment companies established in 2014 Category:Companies based in Los Angeles Category:2014 establishments in California
title: The District (production company)
